intro: Notodanthonia remota, commonly known as the remote grass, is a species of grass native to Australia. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and fine, wiry leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. It is well adapted to drought conditions and can survive in low-nutrient environments. Notodanthonia remota is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
